q: By advertising that[` American Idol'] isn't going to be as mean, they might be losing their professional credibility," says Robert Thompson , a professor of television and pop culture at Syracuse University. It's not as meaningful to get a compliment from someone who's always nice. In past seasons, you'd see people running out of the[ judging] room saying,` Simon Cowell loved me!' Simon Cowell was always the one people cared about, because he was the hardest one to get. Robert Thompson points out that, as a British unknown looking for American fame, Simon Cowell used meanness as a savvy PR move- one that wouldn't work for Jennifer Lopez or Steven Tyler .
